title: The Goddess's Rite Of Rebirth
opening: While the plot to assassinate the archbishop shakes the monastery to its core, you suspect the enemy may have a different motivation. Anxiety abounds as the Goddess's Rite of Rebirth commences.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: I cannot thank you enough for defeating those invaders in the Holy Mausoleum, and especially for protecting the Sword of the Creator. That sword is one of the Heroes' Relics, and the most precious artifact in the church's possession. It is also a weapon of terrifying power. For now...I will entrust the sword to you. Please, use it wisely.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Lady Rhea, wait! Do you truly mean to give the Sword of the Creator to this stranger?! Surely it is not the sort of thing that one hands over so readily, even to someone who has the ability to wield it! If someone like Nemesis were to appear again, all of Fódlan would be consumed by war!

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Nemesis, the King of Liberation. He is an ancient king of mankind who was defeated by Seiros over a thousand years ago. When Fódlan was attacked by wicked gods, it is said that the goddess gifted Nemesis with the Sword of the Creator. Nemesis used that sword to defeat the wicked gods, saving all of Fódlan. Henceforth he was dubbed the King of Liberation. However, his power began to corrupt him until he, himself, turned to the darkness. Saint Seiros was forced to destroy him. Lady Rhea, I beg you to reconsider. Given a little more time, we could more accurately assess this stranger's abilities.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: No. I have faith, Seteth. Faith that our friend here will not be corrupted by wickedness. Since the death of Nemesis, none have been able to wield the Sword of the Creator. Now, after all those long years of being sealed away, it has returned and found a new master.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I...understand. As you wish, Lady Rhea. There you have it, Professor. See that you do not betray the trust the archbishop has seen fit to bestow upon you.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: The Sword of the Creator. The King of Liberation. Each tale is more confusing than the last! And I really can't read that Rhea at all... That sword is clearly precious... So why is she so keen to gift the thing to you?

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: I feel as though we have become entangled in a mystery... And there is one more thing that has been plaguing me. The Sword of the Creator... It somehow feels distinct from other Relics we have seen. Such as the one that... Oh goodness, what was her name? Ca... Cat...

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: What is wrong with that head of yours? Of course it's not a cat! Her name is Catherine.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: The Sword of the Creator differs from her Thunderbrand in one key way. It bears a hole...where something should have been, but is no more. I despise not knowing what is going on! It...it frightens me. And yet... I place my trust in you. I must. Whatever comes to pass...please swear to cut a path that is your own.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: The Sword of the Creator… Pulled right from the legends. I finally found it, and yet it ended up in Teach's hands. Could I even use it anyway? Damn it. There's no telling what's to come…

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: A Hero's Relic...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Do you know something?

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: However could I know something? Still, it is heavy on my mind.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It represents great power.

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: Quite so.

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: The stone within the sword... A glow of red... Hm? Oh, it is nothing.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Our enemy's true target... What could it be? The monastery has been around for nearly a millennium. It's only logical that there are secrets here. We'd better investigate. Would you mind asking around and seeing what you can dig up? Once you've uncovered some leads, we'll regroup.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: We need more information. Is there anyone else you could talk to?

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Hmm... There's a place that the church values above all others. On the day of the rite, it will be open to the public. That will make it much easier than usual to access.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The greenhouse?

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: You must be joking.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The Holy Mausoleum?

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Precisely.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The dining hall?

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: You must be joking.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: We can't know for certain, but it's a distinct possibility that the Holy Mausoleum is our enemy's target.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Oh, have you been tasked with guarding the monastery as well? Such a stir over a single letter...but I suppose the archbishop's safety is too important to risk.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: If the enemy's aim lies elsewhere, we had better discern their true intent quickly. As I see it, our best option is to explore every inch of the monastery. We should also speak to everyone here. Let's plan to compare notes once you've got a lead.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Hmm. I'm afraid we'll need more information than that. Is there anyone else you could try speaking to?

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: So... There is something that the church values above all else. On the day of the rite, it will be open to the public. That will make gaining entry far easier than usual. You know the place of which I speak...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The greenhouse?

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Whatever would make you think that? This is no time for games, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The Holy Mausoleum?

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Yes, that is the most likely possibility.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The dining hall?

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Whatever would make you think that? This is no time for games, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: We do not know their objective, but there is a good chance that our enemy is planning to target the Holy Mausoleum.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: All this talk of assassination plots... It brings back dark memories I prefer to keep buried. I doubt there is any correlation, and yet... Ah, it is nothing. I am sorry for allowing my mind to wander. My focus should be solely on guarding the monastery right now.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: To figure out our foe's intentions, we need information. Lot's of it. Or any, at the least. For now, try going around the monastery and looking for suspicious locations. You should also try chatting folks up to see if they know anything. Once we've got things narrowed down, let's meet up and compare notes.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Hmm... We still don't have enough to go on, Teach. Let's try looking around a little more.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Hmm. Something the church values above all else... And on the day of the rite, it'll be open to the public, making it easier than ever to get inside. That's gotta be it, right?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The greenhouse?

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: That would be a resounding no.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The Holy Mausoleum?

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Bullseye.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The dining hall?

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: That would be a resounding no.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: We don't know the enemy's intentions, not yet. But our best bet is that their target will be the Holy Mausoleum.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: There's been talk of an attempt on Rhea's life. We've been order to help the knights patrol. Could that possibly mean that Rhea isn't beloved by everyone the world over?

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: Can you imagine the archbishop being murdered? I prefer not to consider such a gruesome scenario.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Of course not.

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: Awfully calm, aren't you? I wonder what it takes to rile you up.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Frightening thought.

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: That easy to get under your skin, is it?

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Hmm... Setting fire to the stables to distract everyone, to cause a commotion. It is the oldest trick in the book, but I cannot shake the thought that our enemies may attempt it... I will stand guard and watch over the stable...and the knights' horses. They are truly magnificent.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: So sleepy... Too sleepy... I found an interesting book in the library. Got so caught up reading it I forgot to sleep... Interesting discovery though–the coffins of the Four Saints in the sanctum each have their Crests carved into them. I'll need to find a way down there to get a look.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Oh. Hey, Professor. I was just reading this letter from my father. Do you know him? He's a pretty big deal in the Empire. He only writes to ask how my training's going, or how many monsters I've killed. Stuff like that.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Um... Hi. Right now is, um... Well, right now's OK I guess. If you, um, want to chat...a little.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Didn't I see you in the dining hall last night?

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Hey, I get hungry sometimes. Like anyone else! What? Eating at night is bad for you? There's no way that's true. Wait, really?

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: People die in every battle. And it can be by sword or spear or magic, but... But depending on who it is that died... Depending on who died, it's different.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What do you mean?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's different if it's someone you know who was lost...

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: I hope nothing bad happens this month.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Is it true you got caught in the fighting? I'm so thankful you made it out alive. I don't know what we would do if we lost you...

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: In Brigid... assassinations are many. I have also been the targeted back in the past.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: How frightening.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm happy you survived.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: The Goddess Tower has an entrance of narrowness. That is most good. The windows are not the most good though. A target of ease for snipers.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Fighting to stop a murdering is my specialness...no, my specialty. I will show my best work!

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: The monks declined my offer of assistance. They said that no one from Duscur is to be trusted, especially now. Given the circumstances, I cannot fault them.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Sending an assassin to the monastery, hm? Hopefully it's someone worth crossing blades with.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I hope so too.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: It seems we're cut from the same cloth.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I hope we can avoid bloodshed.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: You're entitled to your opinion.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Lord Lonato's rebellion may have been quelled, but the unrest in Faerghus isn't dying down anytime soon. The boar prince should hurry up and claim the throne, rather than letting old customs hold him back.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: I can't stop thinking about Lonato... I'm sorry, Professor. I know this isn't the time, but... I just can't get past it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: There's nothing to be done.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Pull yourself together.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: Thank you. No matter what happens, I promise you I'll do my part. I checked on my brother and sister who were living in Castle Gaspard. Thankfully they're all right. I was worried because they're both so young, but the church in the castle town offered to take them in. That much, at least, is a big relief.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: No classes on a festival day! I thought I'd get to spend all day relaxing in the company of some lovely ladies, but now this has happened. Hey, Professor, I know there's talk of an assassination attempt, but do you really think they'll do it on the day of the Rite of Rebirth? I feel like security would be looser some other time. Is there some reason why it has to happen on that day?

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: The monastery holds many treasures. Maybe the enemy is after one of those? Even so, the idea of stealing from the church is just horrible...

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: I bought the ingredients for making some sweet treats I can't wait to eats! Huh? Oh! I know it looks like I'm fooling around, but I'm not. I'm preparing for potential battle during my patrol by making sure I have plenty of food I can eat while walking. Smart, huh?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Good thinking.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: I know! Once they're ready, I promise to share some with you.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're making patrol sweets?

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: I just thought I'd be more alert if I had something sweet in my tummy. Oh, wait! Was it spicy food that you liked, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Have you heard? Rumor has it that death himself has been appearing in Garreg Mach. They say he appears every night and kidnaps folks. I wonder what happens to them…

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Professor, while the investigation is important, don't forget to make time for your training. If we have to battle and cannot win, all will be lost. We don't know who our enemy is, so we must be prepared for anything.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Lady Rhea lifts the spirits of all the people of Fódlan. We cannot allow her to come to any harm.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: Are we really just taking Claude's word for it? If so, I doubt anything will come of this. It is all probably just some sort of distasteful joke. I find it highly unlikely that anyone would be foolish enough to barge in here and cause a disturbance.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is the most significant ritual for the Church of Seiros. Could it be that someone has spread these rumors of an assassination plot merely with the intention to hinder the celebration?

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: I bet the enemy's using this assassination nonsense just to sneak in and raid the pantry. What do you think, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You may be right.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Oh, I'm right all right. My animal instinct is telling me that the enemy is after our best meats.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't think so.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: You don't think so? Then dinner's on you if it turns out I was right!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: The monastery's so big. How can we narrow down the list of possible targets? The only places I can think of are the vault and the library, and… I guess that's it.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: With the whole monastery preparing for the Goddess's Rite of Rebirth this month, it feels like everyone's a little on edge…

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: I don't know who to blame for all this commotion, but it's frankly a huge inconvenience. With everyone stuck on guard duty, our study and training time has been drastically reduced.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Some things are more important than that.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Yes, yes, I understand that. But it doesn't change the fact that it's a royal pain.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I agree--it's very inconvenient.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Indeed. For now, let's do all we can to find and dispose of our enemy.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: It seems there were forces opposing the church, beyond Lord Lonato... I never thought such forces could exist in this world.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It makes sense that the church has enemies.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I don't understand. What would they have against the church?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We only know a small part of this world.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I suppose that may be true...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Hello! I'm in charge of managing all records for the Golden Deer House. Oh, but I don't have any information of note right now. Go ahead and continue your investigation. And put a little extra effort into it, please!

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Did you know that, on the last day of the rite, the monastery's open to the general public? It's kinda fun. It makes the place feel like a festival.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Seems like donations to the monastery aren't actually kept here. That means the enemy isn't likely to be interested in money. We should turn our attention elsewhere. Then again, I guess some of the plants in the greenhouse could sell for a lot. But that can't really be it, can it?

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Hey, did you hear? A knight wielding a scythe is roaming around town at night. If he's a villain, I'd like to get the measure of him.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: Hmm... Might you have come looking for me because you were worried about my safety?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I was worried.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: I am quite all right. But your concern means a great deal.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The enemy could have other objectives.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: I am aware of the possibility. On the day of the ceremony, I am trusting that you will not allow your attention to wander or wane.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: I've been in town, procuring some supplies for Flayn.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Did you encounter any danger?

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: No, but do not concern yourself for my safety. I am very much stronger than I appear.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What supplies?

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Nothing out of the ordinary. Do not trouble yourself over it.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Professor... I am afraid I have acted a bit childishly toward my brother recently... Given the circumstances, I requested that he provide me with some candies... Silly of me, really. The timing was improper, and I regret it very much now. Oh, but more importantly, this place is off limits, Professor. It is only open to the public on the day of the Goddess's Rite of Rebirth.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Have you visited the Goddess Tower? It's a sacred place, used for rituals and the like. In general, students aren't allowed entry. But as you'd expect, that rule just excites their curiosity. Some have even tried sneaking in. Well, at least for this month, that kind of behavior is totally unthinkable. We have a lot more security, what with the Goddess's Rite of Rebirth coming up.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: You'd best keep your distance. In this nervous state, I might just cut you down.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Please don't.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I dare you to try.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Oh, come on. I'm only kidding!

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Hey, Professor. You're good-looking, you know that? At the same time, you look like someone who was born to fight. I bet we'd get along. I'm also good-looking and born to fight, heh? Need any help with your class?

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Feel free to call on me when a fight's brewing. Thunderbrand and I will be there when you need us.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: You spend too much time roaming the monastery. If you're looking for something, try less aimless wandering.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I was thinking about the enemy's objective.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Do you even know who the enemy is? You can't know why without knowing who.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not looking for anything.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Sure.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: It's none of my business anyway. I'm just here to take care of enemies who get too close.

conversation.speaker: Jeritza
conversation.line: You're skilled. Why won't you battle me? Hmph.

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: What's the matter? You're running all over creation. Ah... You don't believe Lady Rhea is the real target, do you? Even so, the knights have their orders. We can't abandon our duty to guard Lady Rhea. The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is an important event for the Church of Seiros. They say it's the day when the goddess will return to walk among us. Not too likely, if you ask me. Uh... Best if you keep that to yourself.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Unbelievable. What a terrifying story. However, an assassination attempt on Lady Rhea is doomed to fail. Pardon? You think the goal may be different than simple assassination? Intriguing. I suppose the priceless objects in this room could perhaps draw thieves. However, there's no one but me who could make use of them...

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Professor. I hope you're well. As for me, I had a date with a splendid specimen of a knight. But now he's suddenly not in the mood to see me again. I blame all these rumors of a deathly figure showing up in town. Such an uproar must have, beyond reason, drawn his attention away from me.

conversation.speaker: Tomas
conversation.line: I hear you have fought alongside Catherine. I would wager that her power exceeded your expectations. Had you the chance to witness her Relic? Thunderbrand, glowing red... That glow is a sure sign that her blood contains a Crest that harmonizes with that Hero's Relic.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Excuse me, Professor? I just wanted to let you know that Lady Rhea is always real concerned with you. She expects great things, I think. Please don't let her down, OK?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Of course not.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: I hope you're not just saying that.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll see...

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Ya know what? I'm watching you.

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is this month, right? The monastery gates will be thrown wide open on that day! I'll be working as a guide. I hope I get to guide some lovely ladies around... Heh heh...

conversation.speaker: Squire
conversation.line: The goddess's home is in the sky! She lives on a bright and shining star! But in the spring, you can't see that star. That means she can't protect Fódlan. That's why we all celebrate the day when her star returns to the sky! That's the day of the Rite of Rebirth! See, see? I've been studying! I know just about everything!

conversation.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
conversation.line: People seem to think that all the Knights of Seiros are equal, but that isn't quite so. There are many distinguishing ranks within the order. For example, there are squires, who are training to become knights, as well as full knights, like myself. Oh, and then we have the holy knights, such as Catherine. Those are the knights that can wield a Hero's Relic.

conversation.speaker: Priest
conversation.line: About 20 or so years ago there was a big fire in Garreg Mach. On that day, Captain Jeralt went missing. Everyone thought he was dead... It never occurred to me that he might actually have survived. The truly strange part is that, in all those years, he hasn't changed a bit...

conversation.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
conversation.line: On the day of the rite, the monastery will be open to the public, including the Holy Mausoleum. The Holy Mausoleum is where the tomb of the divine Seiros lies. There she slumbers, eternally. That's...pretty much all that in there. Just an ancient coffin. It's sealed with a powerful magic, to protect against would-be grave robbers.

conversation.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
conversation.line: Have you heard of the War of the Eagle and Lion? It was the battle that won the Kingdom its independence from the Empire. Even the Church of Seiros had no choice but to recognize the courage of Loog, the King of Lions, who emerged victorious. The church awarded him a crown and the right to govern the Faerghus region, backing him in his bid to found the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus. In return, Loog agreed to make the Church of Seiros the religion of his territory, and permitted them to publicly proselytize across the Kingdom. In the 400 years since, the church and the Kingdom have continued to maintain very close relations.

conversation.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
conversation.line: Something in the monastery that someone might go after? There's so much here I couldn't possibly name just one. Even this here kitchen contains previous wares. Wine bottles from centuries past and the like. I hear that stuff is fancy, but not very drinkable. I doubt anyone would go to the trouble of stealing it.

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: It would be terrible if the greenhouse was targeted. The plants in here are incredibly valuable. This place contains the heart of Garreg Mach's 995-year history! So many beautiful flowers... Plants that can save or end lives... They are all my precious children.

conversation.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
conversation.line: I have heard talk of students wandering the monastery late at night. They wouldn't happen to be from your class, would they? Please keep your students in line, Professor. Kids these days...

conversation.speaker: Priest
conversation.line: Do you know what this room is? It is the church's treasure vault. I say treasure, but I do not mean silver and gold and jewels. It mostly contains weapons, artifacts, and the like. Anything that would cause too great a stir should it be stolen? No. The church knows better than to store anything too valuable in such an accessible location.

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: There are numerous books in this library that you cannot find anywhere else. But once you are here, you can read them easily enough. I doubt someone would go to the trouble of stealing one. Sometimes Seteth will dispose of books that are deemed inappropriate for the monastery, but that's about it. In a way, I suppose that makes those particular volumes more valuable... Right?

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: That boy who assists the archbishop... Cyril, I believe? I hear he's originally from a foreign land to the east called Almyra. I know he's still only a child, but I do wonder about his true intentions...

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is about to begin. Are we going to move forward with our plan?

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: I believe so. How confident are you in our theory, Professor?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We're not wrong.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: No one's intuition is perfect. It's ridiculous not to have doubts.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: It could go either way.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Oh, I don't like those odds at all...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'm a little doubtful...

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: You have little doubts? That is good. We have no room for big doubts on this day.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: All that matters is how our enemy makes their move, not how our teacher feels about our plan.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: You seem a mite too relaxed for my liking. The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is about to begin. While we are in the Goddess Tower, we are relying on you to secure the locations that are lacking in defense.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: May I let you in on something, Professor? My brother can be a bit...callous. He told me that he was concerned about you, and hinted that perhaps you would be better off patrolling a coffin!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: That was said in jest, Flayn. And in confidence. Please just remain by my side and do not cause any more trouble. As a professor, you would do well to remember that it is your duty to guide your students down the path of righteousness.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Please excuse us, everyone. We shall see you again after the ceremony has concluded!

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: A coffin. How fascinating.

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Hurry, Professor. We must find a place to hide where we can guard the stairs to the Holy Mausoleum. If the enemy moves as predicted, we should be able to cut off their escape path and capture every last one of them.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is finally here. Let's move ahead with our plan.

intro.speaker: Dedue
intro.line: Leave it to me. Professor, Are you in as well?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: We've narrowed down our objective...kind of. So, let's show everyone that we can carry out our duties better than anyone!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'm not sure about this.

intro.speaker: Mercedes
intro.line: Oh dear. Our professor seems to lack confidence in our plan. That is not very reassuring.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'm hungry.

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: Umm... Oh! Well, I'll be sure to whip you up some tasty treats when this is all over!

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: We're counting on you, Professor.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: You seem a mite too relaxed for my liking. The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is about to begin. While we are in the Goddess Tower, we are relying on you to secure the locations that are lacking in defense.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: May I let you in on something, Professor? My brother can be a bit...callous. He told me that he was concerned about you, and hinted that perhaps you would be better off patrolling a coffin!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: That was said in jest, Flayn. And in confidence. Please just remain by my side and do not cause any more trouble. As a professor, you would do well to remember that it is your duty to guide your students down the path of righteousness.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Please excuse us, everyone. We shall see you again after the ceremony has concluded!

intro.speaker: Dedue
intro.line: It's time.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: All right. Let's stick to the plan, and go hide where we can watch over the entrance to the Holy Mausoleum. If anyone suspicious enters, we'll follow them in and take them down. Got it?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: The Rite of Rebirth is finally underway. Time to see if our hunch was right.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Ugh, I hope it's not. Then we wouldn't have to fight anyone.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Our hunch is right.

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: We've all come to this conclusion together. I'm sure we got it right.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We are mistaken.

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: Do you really believe that, Professor? Claude certainly looks confident.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Only the goddess knows.

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: Dear Goddess... Please protect us...

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Right or wrong, the clock is ticking. All we can do now is stick to the plan.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: You seem a mite too relaxed for my liking. The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is about to begin. While we are in the Goddess Tower, we are relying on you to secure the locations that are lacking in defense.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: May I let you in on something, Professor? My brother can be a bit...callous. He told me that he was concerned about you, and hinted that perhaps you would be better off patrolling a coffin!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: That was said in jest, Flayn. And in confidence. Please just remain by my side and do not cause any more trouble. As a professor, you would do well to remember that it is your duty to guide your students down the path of righteousness.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Please excuse us, everyone. We shall see you again after the ceremony has concluded!

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Seteth is way too overprotective. He reminds me of my brother.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Come on, Teach. I know a hidden spot where we can monitor the stairs that lead to the Holy Mausoleum. If there's anyone down there, they'll be trapped like the rats they are. We'll just have to take them down without getting bitten.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: We were right. Unwanted gusts have come to visit.

battle.speaker: Mysterious Mage
battle.line: Those Central Church dastards have spotted us... Buy me some time while I open the seal on the casket!

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: It is as we suspected. The enemy is within.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Our enemy appears to be after the tomb of Saint Seiros in the back. Are they attempting to steal her bones? It would be best to defeat them before the achieve their aim.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Look closely... There are contraptions of some sort on the floor. We must pay attention to our enemies' weapons and advance while attacking them from advantageous positions.

battle.speaker: Mysterious Mage
battle.line: Death Knight! Prove your strength and scatter these fools!

battle.speaker: Death Knight
battle.line: I don't take commands. Or waste my time on weaklings.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: That knight is a powerful enemy... Let's do all we can to avoid him.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: The enemy is after the casket of Saint Seiros. Do they intend to steal her bones? We must defeat those enemies before they open the casket.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: But look closely at the ground... There are contraptions of some sort in place. We'll have to look closely at the enemies' weapons and advance while attacking them from the best positions possible.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: That knight looks like he has experience. It would be foolish to challenge him recklessly.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Our guess was spot on. Looks like we have company.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Looks like the enemy is going after the casket in the back. Maybe they're going after the saint's bones? Weird. I'd like to defeat them before they can finish the job.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: But did you notice? Look closely at the ground. There's some kind of contraption on certain parts of the floor. The smart move is to advance while finding the best fighting positions we can based on the enemy's weaponry.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: I'm getting a really disturbing vibe from that guy... No one go near the evil-looking knight, OK?

battle.speaker: Mysterious Mage
battle.line: The reinforcements haven't arrived?! If they approach from behind, we can attack them from both sides...

battle.speaker: Mysterious Mage
battle.line: It's no use! The seal is broken. You can't— Huh? A sword?

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: I told you that if you fled, I would not chase you. But it seems you wish to die...

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: I didn't expect to encounter someone like you... How fortunate.

boss.speaker: Mysterious Mage
boss.line: You're too late! The seal will be broken any minute now...

boss.speaker: Mysterious Mage
boss.line: It's no use! The seal is broken. You can't– Huh? A sword?

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: There's no way around it... I accept your challenge!

boss.speaker: Mercedes
boss.line: Oh my, how frightening! Won't you please go easy on me?

end.speaker: Death Knight
end.line: That sword is...I see. What a pleasant surprise.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Ugh, he got away! That sword... Why is it –

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: That's the sword that was in the casket. Seems to be shimmering, almost as though...

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: He got away... We have no choice but to let them go for now. Professor... The way that sword is glowing. I wonder...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: The jerk got away. Was that magic? We can't even chase after him. Hey, Professor. The way that sword is shining... Do you think it could be...

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: Is the intruder here?! Oh... Looks like you have this under control. You! Round up any stragglers.

end.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
end.line: Will do!

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: As all of you have committed a breach of faith, the archbishop will now pass judgement.

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: Inciting a Kingdom noble to rebel. Unlawful entry. The attempted assassination of the archbishop. An attack on the Holy Mausoleum. It is unnecessary to go on, followers of the Western Church.

end.speaker: Priest
end.line: What?! We have nothing to do with the Western Church!

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: You have already been identified. Please spare us your second-rate theater.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Dishonoring a holy ceremony is worthy of death for a member of the church. You are well past the hope of redemption. If you have any grace remaining, you will willingly offer your life as atonement for this crime.

end.speaker: Priest
end.line: No! This isn't what we were told would happen! We've been deceived!

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: It's no use arguing. Whatever your excuse, the punishment stands.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: May your souls find peace as they return to the goddess...

end.speaker: Priest
end.line: Wait! Please! The goddess would never forgive you for our execution!

end.speaker: Priest
end.line: Monster! We know you've already slaughtered many of our fellow brethren like this!

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: This concludes the investigation. Please remove these poor, lost souls from my sight.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: That's that, I suppose. The assassination attempt, the attack on the Holy Mausoleum... It was all the Western Church's doing. That masked knight who led the attack somehow managed to disappear without a trace.

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: The Church of Seiros clearly isn't as unified as it would hope to appear. It seems the bishop of the Western Church was always opposed to the church being ruled centrally from Garreg Mach. Perhaps they hope to remove the archbishop in order to completely strip the Central Church of its authority.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The Western Church...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The Central Church?

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Ugh, that's right. Jeralt mentioned that you were raised without any exposure to the church. In order to function more efficiently, the Church of Seiros is split into several smaller entities. The Central Church is the largest and leads the organization from Garreg Mach.

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: The Western Church extends from Castle Gaspard, where Lord Lonato rebelled into the far west. They can be found just beyond the most renowned stronghold of the Kingdom, the Fortress City of Arianrhod.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: It seems the knights have been tasked with subduing the leaders of the Western Church. We may be give an opportunity to help them with their mission.

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: To think...our own professor was born in Fódlan and yet knew nothing of the church. I never imagined explaining something so basic to an instructor of mine. You're something of a special case, are you not?

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: How strange that the archbishop would ask someone like that to lead her students. There's clearly more to that decision than we know.

end.speaker: Caspar
end.line: Lady Rhea is pretty scary sometimes...but to execute that whole group just like that? It seems harsh, even for her.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: If one of us does something bad, I wonder what she would do to us!

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Professor... Do you agree with the archbishop's actions?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: There you have it... It seems that the assassination attempt and the attack on the Holy Mausoleum were all the work of the Western Church. As for the masked knight who led the attack... I'm afraid his whereabouts are yet unknown.

end.speaker: Dedue
end.line: It makes no sense that the Western Church would try such a thing.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: It just goes to show that the Church of Seiros is not completely united. The church is led by those here in Garreg Mach, and the Western Church doesn't have a strong voice on its governing council. I imagine the Western Church has harbored some resentment towards the Central Church for a while now.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The Western Church...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The Central Church?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Ah, that's right. Jeralt did say that you grew up outside the influence of the church. The Church of Seiros is split into a few branches across Fódlan. The largest being the Central Church, which is headquartered right here at Garreg Mach.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: The Western Church lies far to the west of Castle Gaspard, where Lord Lonato held his rebellion. It's situated on the far side of the Kingdom's most impressive fortress, Arianrhod. I imagine the Western Church's intention was to eliminate Lady Rhea, and the Central Church's authority along with her. Naturally, the knights will be riding out to question the Western Church's top officials. Or rather...to punish them.

end.speaker: Dedue
end.line: When they do, Your Highness, we will likely be asked to carry out said punishment.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Indeed. Now, I don't mean to be rude, Professor, but I must say that your situation is rather unusual. For someone to grow up in Fódlan and yet never have any contact with the Church of Seiros is...it's hard to believe.

end.speaker: Dedue
end.line: I wonder why the archbishop would hire someone like that as a professor...

end.speaker: Ashe
end.line: So...those people from the Western Church were... Um, Lady Rhea had them killed, didn't she?

end.speaker: Mercedes
end.line: Well, of course she did. Going against the teachings of Seiros like that. Quite unforgivable!

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: Those who stray must be punished, I suppose. That said... Professor, I–

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I suppose that's that. The assassination attempt, the attack on the Holy Mausoleum... Looks like it was all a plot by the Western Church. It's just too bad that that masked knight who was leading the attack got away. Vanished without a trace.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: But why would the Western Church want to attack Lady Rhea?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Why? Take your pick of reasons. Relations with the Western Church aren't exactly friendly.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The Western Church...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: What reasons?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Oh, that's right. Jeralt mentioned that you grew up completely isolated from the church. The Church of Seiros is split into a few different branches across Fódlan. The Central Church is headquartered right here at Garreg Mach.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Then there's the Western Church. Far west from Castle Gaspard, where Lord Lonato had his little rebellion, is the Fortress City of Arianrhod. It's the strongest fortress in the Kingdom. On the other side of it is the headquarters of the Western Church.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Not too smart to bicker with people who worship the same goddess as you.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: The bishop of the Western Church must be pretty ambitious. Probably hopes to split off completely. In which case, he'd need to weaken the Central Church's influence. Killing Rhea is certainly one way to do that. To the shock of no one, I hear the knights have been sent to subdue the leaders of the Western Church. We'll probably get a chance to assist.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: You're an odd one, aren't you, Professor? How'd you make it this far in life without ever interacting with the church? I can't believe someone like you exists in Fódlan. It's too strange!

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: If you think that's weird, consider the fact that Rhea hired Teach despite all that.

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: So, those guys they caught... They all got the axe, right? That's brutal.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Lady Rhea can be rather intimidating at times. In fact...she can be downright terrifying.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: Professor. Those who cannot be saved must be delivered to the goddess for judgement. Is that not so?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: There you are, Professor. It seems Lady Rhea would like a word with you. Come with me.

end.speaker: Lord Arundel
end.line: The archbishop lives. Not that I had ever placed much faith in those swine from the Western Church.

end.speaker: Flame Emperor
end.line: I have news, both good and bad. The remains of Seiros were not in the tomb. However, something else was. The Sword of the Creator.

end.speaker: Lord Arundel
end.line: Ah, the weapon wielded by that thief, the King of Liberation.

end.speaker: Flame Emperor
end.line: Thief? Hm. At any rate, it is now in the hands of the academy's new professor. I doubt you will be surprised to hear that the Crest Stone had already been removed from the sword when it was found.

end.speaker: Lord Arundel
end.line: Hmph. As expected. It would be foolish to keep both in the same location.

end.speaker: Flame Emperor
end.line: There's more. The professor was able to awaken the sword's true power. Even without the Crest Stone, the sword glowed red. The professor's Crest is compatible. There is no mistaking it.

end.speaker: Lord Arundel
end.line: Absurd. Using a Relic without its Crest Stone should be impossible... The King of Liberation's bloodline should not even... Hmm.

end.speaker: Flame Emperor
end.line: They must be allowed to keep it, for now. I do not have enough information about the professor to act. As for your request, I assent. The Death Knight is at your command. Use him well.

end.speaker: Lord Arundel
end.line: Good. I believe I will enjoy this a great deal...
